node.display_long_description:
A cooperative and chaotic party game that requires you to shout technobabble at your friends! Play with people on mobile/tablet and with other VR players online. You can also shout at yourself in practice mode. 

Attempt to follow randomly generated, incorrectly assigned instructions.

If your Spaceteam can complete enough instructions successfully in a sector you will progress to the next, each sector becomes increasingly difficult and as the ship becomes harder to control!

FULL VR MULTIPLAYER
Up to 6 players, connected to the internet, in any popular VR headset join in a coop game of trying to avoid their binding doom.

FACE TO FACE
Up to 6 players locally with at least one headset and connected smart devices, this offers an experience much like the original Spaceteam game.

SINGLE PLAYER
In Practice Mode you will join 2 of our trusty robots!

And remember to work together… as a Spaceteam!

latest_supported_binary.change_log:
General
•	Improved performance on Quest/Quest2
•	General improvements made to positioning of hands when grabbing objects
•	Improvements to the grip accuracy for dials
•	Improved accuracy for collisions of Robot hands
•	Improved positioning of objects grabbed by Robot hands
•	Chair model added for users using seated mode
•	Increased the threshold needed to be reached by all players for the pump anomaly

Bug Fixes
•	Fixed a bug where settings were set as save before the save occurred
•	Fixed a bug where you could spawn outside of the lobby
•	Fixed a bug where avatar wrists would either appear disconnected or broken
•	Fixed a bug where Robots would either read instructions wrong or not at all with more complex instructions
•	Fixed a bug where a Robot’s speech could stop all together
•	Fixed a bug where the Robot would continue reading redundant instructions, even if a new instruction is ready
•	Fixed a bug where a Robot would not finish its current instruction on the end of a sector
•	Fixed a bug where the height calibration screen was grabbable
•	Fixed a bug with the report menu, where it’s buttons where not usable
•	Fixed a bug where incorrect LOD groups were being used for some avatar textures
•	Fixed a bug with the pump anomaly where the game would not progress, even if completed
•	Fixed a server crash caused by internal checks in the game’s logic

nodes.title: New Years (Bug) Resolutions!
nodes.body_text:
Oculus Quest
- Added an option for selecting refresh rate on Quest 2

General
- Keep an eye out for ‘News Available’ notifications about our upcoming updates!

Bug Fixes
- Fixed a bug that caused joining via code to place players in the wrong game
- Fixed a bug that would allow players to join a game after it had started
- Fixed a bug where the user could be pushed back by the in-game menu
- Fixed a bug that caused the “public game” notification to appear for private games


Thank you for playing and please leave a review if you're enjoying the game and if not please get in touch with us!

Also please remember to join us on Thursday and Saturday's for our regular events!

nodes.title: UPDATE TIME - 3652 (15th December)
nodes.body_text:
Festive Greetings, Space Cadets!

Just before we wrap things up for Christmas, we’re excited to announce the latest update for Spaceteam VR across all supported platforms.

This update contains several tweaks and quality of life improvements, and for the first time ever, you can now play as our iconic robots! The robots are now selectable as the player avatar in the customisation options.

General

- VOIP quality improvements, fixes for some cut-outs and non-working voice that could occur!
- Improved Quest performance
- Smoothed out the movement of our UFOs
- Added “player has joined” notifications
- Incorrect player names sometimes being shown has been fixed up
- Threw away the pumpkins left over from Halloween! (they were starting to go a little funky)

Networking

- Game lobbies now show if open or in progress
- Fixed incorrect region selection
- Improved networking of thrown objects, fixes up debris issues

Quest Specific

- Fixed up colour space on Quest 1 + 2
- Increased FX visual quality on Quest 2

Controls

- Fixed sponge collisions with some controls
- Fixes to the pump thresholds and added notifications to it, pumping should
now be 42% more fun!

Symbol mode

- Improved the readability of multi-glyph controls
- Fixed up incidental instructions breaking symbols appearing for all the panel

Robots

- You can now play as one of our three robots! 
(CRT-3000, Cylindrake and Priscilla)
- Should now be friendlier and wave at you properly!
- Gave them a few tweaks and upgraded their OS

Difficulty

- Tweaked hard mode to make the difficulty increase between sectors a little smoother

We also have further updates coming in the new year offering more ways to play with your friends, new types of anomalies and reducing the wait time on multiplayer games!

node.reviewDescription:
The game is fun and the new VR game play elements are very nice additions. I was a fan of the game in the iPhone and when I saw it on the quest and got it and offered it to two friends. I have 4 starts because quite a lot le time is wasted getting everyone to be able to eat each other so we can play and it’s only in English. 

Alas it’s still better on iOS because there it’s available in many language. I can play in English but French is my 1st language and the iOS French version is sooooo hilarious. 
Developers please translate tout game on the Qu’este too

developerResponse.body:
Hi there. Thanks for playing Spaceteam VR and leaving a review.

We're delighted to announce that localisation is coming soon. Most of the work on our end is already done. However, we have a couple of updates in the works which add new content and some minor UI updates, so we're in the process of having those extra phrases localised. Once all of these updates come together, we'll be able to launch them with localisation.

website_page_meta.description: A cooperative and chaotic party game that requires you to shout technobabble at your friends! You need to work together… as a Spaceteam!
website_page_meta.title: Spaceteam VR · Oculus Quest
